results.title: Gracia Baylor
results.creator_credit: Helen Simondson, Lisetta Moscardo and ACMI
results.brief_description: Gracia Baylor was the first woman President of the Shire of Healesville, now Yarra Ranges Shire Council, and one of the first two women to be elected to the Victorian Legislative Council. Gracia has been an active leader of women’s organisations, including President of the National Council of Women (NCW) of Victoria 1990-93 and President of NCW Australia 1997-2000. In 1999, Gracia was made a Member of the Order of Australia (AM) in recognition of her services to Parliament and women’s affairs. She is a member of two Federal Government Advisory Committees.
results.description: Gracia Baylor was the first woman President of the Shire of Healesville, now Yarra Ranges Shire Council, and one of the first two women to be elected to the Victorian Legislative Council. Gracia has been an active leader of women’s organisations, including President of the National Council of Women (NCW) of Victoria 1990-93 and President of NCW Australia 1997-2000. In 1999, Gracia was made a Member of the Order of Australia (AM) in recognition of her services to Parliament and women’s affairs. She is a member of two Federal Government Advisory Committees.
description_for_label: Gracia Baylor was the first woman President of the Shire of Healesville, now Yarra Ranges Shire Council, and one of the first two women to be elected to the Victorian Legislative Council. Gracia has been an active leader of women’s organisations, including President of the National Council of Women (NCW) of Victoria 1990-93 and President of NCW Australia 1997-2000. In 1999, Gracia was made a Member of the Order of Australia (AM) in recognition of her services to Parliament and women’s affairs. She is a member of two Federal Government Advisory Committees.

results.title: Judy Maddigan
results.creator_credit: Helen Simondson, Lisetta Moscardo and ACMI
results.brief_description: Judy Maddigan was the first woman Deputy Speaker and was the first woman to be appointed the Speaker of The Legislative Assembly in Victoria in 2003. Maddigan has a strong commitment to community and was elected as a Member of Parliament to represent the Electoral District of Essendon in the Legislative Assembly in 1996. During her time as speaker Maddigan implemented many changes in the 150 year old parliament to improve the lives of workers and also public accessibility. She is a librarian at heart and is currently the Member for Essendon.
results.description: Judy Maddigan was the first woman Deputy Speaker and was the first woman to be appointed the Speaker of The Legislative Assembly in Victoria in 2003. Maddigan has a strong commitment to community and was elected as a Member of Parliament to represent the Electoral District of Essendon in the Legislative Assembly in 1996. During her time as speaker Maddigan implemented many changes in the 150 year old parliament to improve the lives of workers and also public accessibility. She is a librarian at heart and is currently the Member for Essendon.
description_for_label: Judy Maddigan was the first woman Deputy Speaker and was the first woman to be appointed the Speaker of The Legislative Assembly in Victoria in 2003. Maddigan has a strong commitment to community and was elected as a Member of Parliament to represent the Electoral District of Essendon in the Legislative Assembly in 1996. During her time as speaker Maddigan implemented many changes in the 150 year old parliament to improve the lives of workers and also public accessibility. She is a librarian at heart and is currently the Member for Essendon.

results.title: A Colour Box
results.brief_description: The purely abstract A Colour Box” was Len Lye’s first experiment with painting in colour directly onto celluloid. After its initial release in 1935, John Grierson acquired the film for the United Kingdom General Post Office, and it was re-released in 1937 as an advertisement.

constellations_other.name: Circling expanded cinema
constellations_other.description: Explore how expanded cinema like Lis Rhodes' Light Music connects to film composers, experimental materials and virtual reality.

results.description: The purely abstract “A Colour Box” was Len Lye’s first experiment with painting in colour directly onto celluloid. After its initial release in 1935, John Grierson acquired the film for the United Kingdom General Post Office, and it was re-released in 1937 as an advertisement, with the addition of a “cheaper parcel post” message. Note: this film has been restored by the National Film and Television Archive (UK) from Lye’s original material using the Eastmancolor process.
description_for_label: The purely abstract “A Colour Box” was Len Lye’s first experiment with painting in colour directly onto celluloid. After its initial release in 1935, John Grierson acquired the film for the United Kingdom General Post Office, and it was re-released in 1937 as an advertisement, with the addition of a “cheaper parcel post” message. Note: this film has been restored by the National Film and Television Archive (UK) from Lye’s original material using the Eastmancolor process.

results.title: Tusalava
results.brief_description: 1. Lye’s first film was originally accompanied by live music by Jack Ellit. No score was ever found, so the film presented here is silent, a vision of the beginnings of life on earth - mixing Maori, silent and modernist influences.
results.description: 1. Lye’s first film was originally accompanied by live music by Jack Ellit. No score was ever found, so the film presented here is silent, a vision of the beginnings of life on earth - mixing Maori, silent and modernist influences.

results.title: Contentment
results.creator_credit: Noel Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A shearer for thirty years, Noel Atkinson’s life was turned upside down when he discovered he had Parkinson’s Disease. His new found passion in art and woodwork however has enabled him to live with this debilitating disease and provide comfort and strength in his everyday life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Noel Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: A shearer for thirty years, Noel Atkinson’s life was turned upside down when he discovered he had Parkinson’s Disease. His new found passion in art and woodwork however has enabled him to live with this debilitating disease and provide comfort and strength in his everyday life.
description_for_label: A shearer for thirty years, Noel Atkinson’s life was turned upside down when he discovered he had Parkinson’s Disease. His new found passion in art and woodwork however has enabled him to live with this debilitating disease and provide comfort and strength in his everyday life.

results.title: Strong and Proud
results.creator_credit: Darren Atkinson and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Darren grew up on Cummeragunja Mission and in this digital story he talks about his grandfather’s life, the Koori community and the handing down of Indigenous traditions and culture from one generation to the next.
results.description: Darren grew up on Cummeragunja Mission and in this digital story he talks about his grandfather’s life, the Koori community and the handing down of Indigenous traditions and culture from one generation to the next.

results.title: Leaving My Country
results.creator_credit: Grant Hood, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: An argument with his uncle one night would turn out to be a life-changing experience for Grant Hood, a proud Kurnai Gunai man. Grant mentions the importance of his meeting with Kutcha Edwards when he first arrives in Melbourne. A photo of a very young Kutcha is also shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Grant Hood, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
